description.para: The sequence of documents to split.
The documents from the source port that match.
The documents from the source port that do not match.
If false (default), all documents for which the expression in the test option is true are considered matched, all documents for which this is false are considered non-matched.
If true, the first document for which the expression in the test option is false splits the sequence in matched/non-matched. See below.
The XPath boolean expression, as a string, that defines matching.

summary.para: The step takes a sequence of documents on its source port and divides this into two sequences, based on the evaluation expression in the test option.

description.para: The value of the test option must be an XPathExpression.

The XPath expression in the test option is applied to each document in the input sequence. If the effective boolean value of the expression is true, the document is copied to the matched port; otherwise it is copied to the not-matched port.

If the initial-only option is true, then when the first document that does not satisfy the test expression is encountered, it and all the documents that follow it are written to the not-matched port. In other words, it only writes the initial series of matched documents (which may be empty) to the matched port. All other documents are written to the not-matched port, irrespective of whether or not they match.

The XPath context for the test option changes over time. For each document that appears on the source port, the expression is evaluated with that document as the context document. The context position (position()) is the position of that document within the sequence and the context size (last()) is the total number of documents in the sequence. [ERROR ]

note.para: In principle, this component cannot stream because it must buffer all of the input sequence in order to find the context size. In practice, if the test expression does not use the last() function, the implementation can stream and ignore the context size.

description.para: If the implementation supports passing PSVI annotations between steps, the p:split-sequence step must preserve any annotations that appear in the input.
